alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, EASTERN HAMILTON, NORTHERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Mariemont, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Mason, Lebanon, Norwood, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Wyoming, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Deer Park and Fort Wright. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 25, and between mile markers 29 and 34. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 190 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
